intro: Ochlopoa raniglumis, commonly known as the golden tamarind, is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow-orange flowers. The plant produces pods containing edible seeds that are rich in nutrients. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires a warm, humid climate. Ochlopoa raniglumis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and as a source of food.
